zVn5xGEY3WIMj0N9_qLeCg.text: I had the lobster tacos and peanut butter wicked woopie at Pitts downtown yesterday and that was amazing!!

ZvbUqAkY5m__bdxs5cbAfg.text: Craft beer and lobster rolls, what's not to love.  I even stood in 20 degree weather with 15mph winds to get a warm lobster roll.  Clam chowder is amazing as well

JUW7r64fbdXFfpHMt4CtKg.text: I drove past this truck and stopped on a whim, and was so happy I did!  I ordered a Connecticut style roll, which came loaded with sweet lobster meat.   Will definitely be hitting this truck again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Connecticut style roll

t0Y-IQDH13A1-xtDUNaoDA.text: So I was off from work and decided to give this place a shot since I heard they would be close to my house. I pulled up and saw one of the largest lines I've ever seen. I had no idea this place had such a great reputation the line had around 30-40 people. I waited for at least an hour maybe more so I was very hungry by the time I got to order. So I just decided to get both rolls and try them out. Getting both rolls sure didn't come cheap spending $35. Both of the rolls were very good however, for the price the size of the roll I'd say either needs to bigger and more lobster or the tots come with the roll free. Because I spent $35 and I honestly was still a little hungry. I'd definitely go back and try the lobster bisque and I'd order the lobster roll again I liked both of them equally the same. I loved the fact the gave you a fresh lemon wedge too. Definitely nice to have lobster truck here in Pittsburgh as there's seafood is hard to come by.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wGM3HnSTReGPNVC8r4FabA.text: Excellent fresh lobster and great service. Good local eats would definitely recommend!

KpZtiTUqTDC4fznw-qFFjw.text: Lobster tots and and rolls are amazing! My picky eater of a 4 year old will eat everything on the menu. We have visited this truck numerous times and have never been disappointed.

xuEuJ0g0x0K1poobR9XSZg.text: Went to the Pittsburgh Food Truck Park tonight after Mother's Day dinner just planning on having a beer with the family.  It was our 1st visit so we were checking out the options - and lo and behold - There was Cousins Maine Lobster that I've been wanting to try!  Although I was still full from dinner I got a cup of their Lobster Bisque and it was awesome!   Soooo many things on the menu that I want to try, so I'll definitely be back.  Also met one of the owners and she was super nice.  I'm definitely going back!!!

K9CjfqKUwuG5GOHj-bp8bw.text: Lobster rolls in Pittsburgh??  Yes!!  Connecticut roll is full of meaty lobster with a small smear of mayo on a delicious toasty roll.  Worth every penny.  Tater tots were tasty too.  The only thing I didn't enjoy was the whoopie pie - I absolutely love whoopie pies and this one was a nice size but the filling tasted metallic to me.  Wouldn't get that again.

HVo6ZlLfg2tbe-x79CNRcQ.text: I dropped by on a whim and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice and friendly everyone was for being so busy! They had a line the whole time. I got the Maine roll and it was full to the top soooo good and came out looking delicious. I will absolutely be finding them again!

xEINrAyP4e3iByeJJwhtsQ.text: Not really sure why this truck has gotten so many good reviews.  I've been to a lot of food trucks in Pittsburgh and this one is not worth the money, nor the wait.  I got the Connecticut Lobster Roll and a cup of Lobster Bisque.  The roll was tiny.  I'm talking hot dog bun with some lobster on it.  Yes, I get that lobster is expensive, but for $15.75, it would be nice if they threw in a little side. I ate the sandwich in three bites. The bisque was barely lukewarm and not much flavor.  Won't be going back and won't be recommending.  Sorry, Cousins Maine Lobster.

fFJUVG5Wol5gTQAEq6puWA.text: I don't mind paying good money for lobster but this was horrible. $16 and 2 hours in line got me a 4" hot dog bun with stringy, dry lobster. Also bought a prepackaged Whoopie pie that was no better than a little Debbie cake.

araLfiow9WHyqCCRTnM4MQ.text: Cousins Maine lobster Pittsburgh is A) the best food truck I've ever encountered. And B) they could possibly be the nicest group of people I've encountered in a food truck. And C) the service I've received from cousins Maine Pittsburgh has led me to want to have a Maine lobster truck of my own someday. I strongly support Cousins Maine Lobster. If your lucky enough to come across a Cousins Maine Lobster truck someday, I suggest having the Lobster grilled cheese will the lobster bisque on the side, only if you've already had the lobster roll. I'd like to believe that all Cousins Maine lobster trucks are created equal, however that can't be True. Because I know that the one in Pittsburgh cannot be topped. This may seem like opinion, however, it is not. And I say this for one reason. To have you come to Pittsburgh and try cousins Maine lobster Pittsburgh. Because once you do, you will understand that my review is in fact, Fact.

4rItM8YyXqRdnDCF0Zfi4A.text: My husband and I went to the Food Park in Millvale tonight as a fun way of celebrating our 41st anniversary.  Despite the downpour, Cousins Maine did not disappoint.  Hands down, this was the best lobster roll I have ever had in my life.  Efficient and cheerful service, a roll lightly toasted to perfection, and the lobster?  Out-of-this-world.  My husband had the lobster quesadilla.  Our only regret was that we didn't place a double order for everything.  We will definitely seek this food truck out as often as our budget (and the food truck's location) allow!

QFm-0Zlv1H1XonzbC8NN-w.text: Absolutely Delish!!! Now a regular follower!!  (:  totally worth the wait, just order extra! (:

gZjFlTitjc5yWCCKXipRlA.text: So fun to be able to get a real Maine Lobster roll.  When near the New England coast I always look for some of the little lobster shak's and they never disappoint.  Had the Maine Lobster roll with a nice amount of lobster on the typical buttered lobster roll.  Sooooo good!  Also had a cup of the Lobster Bisque.  The Bisque was very tasty and cheesy and just OK.  The price of the items on the menu seemed a tad high as compared to the lobster shak's I have been to.  The line was a little long but worth the wait.

hieTo46QCtlwl5OkxPvI3A.text: Wow, wow, wow. I had heard about this truck and was so excited to finally be at an event where it. It was at the 2018 Greater Pittsburgh Food Truck festival at the Meadows Casino. The festival started at noon, we showed up at 12:10 And the line for Cousins was already very long!. Note to self, this truck is more popular than I was led to believe, show up early! After a 40+ minute wait in the hot sun I made my way to the window. They had tv's on the truck with the menu items and prices, but honestly they were very hard to see because of the sun. They also had printed photos of their items and it would have been a much better idea for them to have the prices listed on those pictures for people to see. It would also speed up the line because I could see people were taking forever to order. I was smart enough to examine the menu on my phone whole I was in line so I didn't have an issue. Another note is that they take cash or credit which is nice because their items are not cheap, $15/roll. I went with the Maine Lobster roll, their cold lobster roll version. They also have a Connecticut Roll which is served hot, lobster tots and tacos. I was so very surprised when I saw the roll, I had been anticipating this moment for quite awhile! Large, and I mean very large, hunks and claws of lobster. I loved the fact that is had his the absolute bare minimum amount of mayo and there was a little wedge of lemon to squeeze over the succulent lobster. So fresh and delicious. I was almost sad I didn't order two! Forgive my skepticism thinking that a Food truck in PA would have a good lobster roll!  I will most definitely be back for another when I see this truck at a future event. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maine Lobster Rolls. Delicious!

tQsxwntkToxAuRPg_yXHxA.text: It was a good thing to try and the wait of two hours was worth a first try but I probably would not wait that amount of time again. The lobster itself was delicious, bisque was not the best I ever had but far from the worst, surprisingly liked the Maine roll better than the Connecticut. There is not enough mayo on the Maine to even notice it, but enough to accentuate the sweetness of the lobster perfectly.

GRI_9Zx77sOsOMi7oMVJGA.text: THE  REAL DEAL!!!!  Freaking amazing.  I was transported to Maine and will follow these guys to satisfy my lobster cravings!!  Had the Connecticut roll and lobster tots (sans pico). AMAZING!!!!   Huge hunks of lobster. Taste is SO fresh...really!!  I'm transported to Maine.    Thank you for bing legit!!!

YkW6rmSVWDyYuRhSfDZeDQ.text: So overpriced... Ok, I know it's fresh lobster, but I ordered extra meat and he "forgot" to add it. That's how you make money, people...

-dMrRav5Zd2ghzo-PzeZ1w.text: Very pricey for a food truck BUT there is a lot of lobster in the rolls and grilled cheese. We actually tried both rolls - the Maine is cold while the Connecticut is warm. We both preferred the cold roll.  The lobster grilled cheese is in Texas toast which a perfect amount of cheese.  Even got a cup of lobster bisque; my only complaint about it was the lobster was minced into tiny pieces.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maine lobster roll - oops I already took a bite

XUja-3ie-SlTh2Zui59ScA.text: We were able to visit this truck while it was at the Millvale Food Truck Park on a busy weekend.  The line was very long but it was well worth it. The food tasted absolutely delicious and I can't wait to try them again.

apZ7tdz2ehw4US82BVBTfQ.text: First time at food truck park, and had the Cousin Maine Lobster the Connecticut roll... Wow!! It was awesome, and had a boat load of lobster on it. Certainly going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My really good friend having dessert with me. Great evening!!This was Sinkers and Suds dessert truck at food park.
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sinker and Donuts. Great way to end an evening.
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great food truck!! Connecticut lobster roll is awesome!!

-NEdJzRcr7oEvdfdqmCoqA.text: The people working at cousins main lobster couldn't be more friendly and inviting. The "Connecticut" roll is delicious with more than enough lobster. You can add more lobster (which I did) for just $4. It was fantastic! Will ABSOLUTELY be going back! Great product!

eXeKt2yJUfjB4Dnj3TH9-A.text: Cousins Maine Lobster is so fresh. I have traveled to Martha's Vineyard frequently & Cousins definitely makes me feel like I'm in the upper Northeast !! Very efficient service & also awesome staff !! Hands down amazing !!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So happy Cousins is in PGH. We love all the food &amp; most importantly our little guys loves the tater tots
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9cUucEF6Eh9PRAzz9W9-Qw.text: Yum!!  I've been waiting for quality lobster in Pittsburgh.   It's a little bit of a splurge and totally worth it. I had the Maine Lobster Roll. It's cold lobster with mayo and fresh lemon, served on a buttery bread.  It was delicious. I want to try everything they have on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gSLLa0RV5I12vAZkoCXDTg.text: Maine roll was AHHMAZING. By far my favorite item on the menu. You guys really know how to do it right, 5 stars for me!

KrIbWSjbArQNJjIZ5NUebQ.text: Just spent hour and a half waiting in line to get to the food truck in Millvale at the Cinco de Mayo festival. Lobster rolls were fair, not great. Lobster bisque way poor and was absent of lobster. Not a great experience in relation to the very high cost. Bummer. Drove a long way to try it. Lessons learned

zTykqQXs1-GR_u6mIootEw.text: Cousins Lobster Truck Came to Ford City for the second time this year thinking that last month was a good month that they came back for a second time once again they are very pricey but for the product it is unique for our town, I had the bowl of lobster bisque  and it was totally delicious and I urge you to support them. That also the Cod that was sold by the Renaissance committee was Top Shelf very delicious however I cannot see how you can call a fish sandwich a piece of fish between two pieces of bread? Sad sad.

f2I3qhsWSK_4DOWnxxkY2A.text: If you've not tried this truck, you are missing out!  I always get 2 lobster rolls.  I eat the hot toasted one there, then eat the cold one the following day.  The L rolls are as good as I have had in any New England state!

dQsp6UkoVSTlz2Z9fseE5Q.text: Super delicious but the portions aren't great. I was full after eating my yummy lobster quesadilla but my husband was not. This place works great for a snack but not for a meal. I would definitely eat here again if the opportunity arises.

Cih2qlrfva0J8IzoqhAVmQ.text: Absolutely delicious and well worth the wait! We will definitely be back to the truck again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

amwrWfHHqSw7LFQxlSERnw.text: This is incredible. If you like Lobster and cant get to Maine easily, this is your alternative. Great Lobster roll and she crab bisque.

TNpO5gje-jRmFywKK9P3rg.text: I've found these guys in two different locations after my first experience because I love them. The people working the truck are absolutely amazing! The food is as well. . It helps that the people who work are nice because it makes you want to go back for more when you can find them.

30QNMriCwdlI-dmwoMDU-Q.text: Pricey but REALLY good! I probably over ordered and got 2 rolls along with half from one of my daughters. The line was long but they had enough product on hand to accommodate everyone in line at the event. I got the traditional style and my wife and kids got the butter version. I would definitely go out if my way to visit this truck

HMxZq8Pb7NgrsP4AKDGhnA.text: Overpriced, no flavor, and the staff isn't very friendly. My husband got the lobster quesadilla and there was literally about 4 of the tiniest pieces of lobster in the mix of not a very good cheese. I get that lobster is expensive. Quesadillas with cheese are very inexpensive to make. You should at least see some bulk between the slices to warrant the price for the lobster, yet it is flat as it really just has cheese in it. I don't mind paying for good food but there is nothing to rave about here. Such a disappointment as it's a unique food truck. At the end of the day it's either butter bread with minimal lobster, or a quesadilla with cheese and not enough to taste.

NCU9aMaIiYbFuzSIsvreSg.text: Beware. Westmoreland residents they charge 7% sales tax. Then tell you they can't change computer. They'll tell owner.  Food is good. Lobster a bit tough. Pricey. I don't like someone making a nice profit but still gouging for another %.

6baCjL2F9resavhZ0aDcqw.text: Fresh, Friendly, Price.....? Perfect... - You won't find this quailty of Maine lobster for a better deal unless....you want to drive to Boston. - (Tom Brady was working this evening)

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#39;Laubstir Rule&#39; Connecticut

yOP9gEQiyoQk5L8CHBYy3Q.text: Food Truck day at Work!  I chose Cousin's Maine Lobster cause quite frankly, there aren't many places in Pittsburgh that have a Lobster Roll and its been a while since I had one.  The wait was extremely long, and slow.  Only three people working in the truck, but lets be honest, you can't fit that many people into a food truck, so I was not surprised or discouraged by the wait time.  I didn't wait as long as a lot of other people that showed up later than I did.  I've read a few other reviews here on Yelp and there is a consistent trend, the prices.  Yes,...paying $12 for a grilled cheese sandwich is absurd, but how many grilled cheese sandwiches have lobster in them?  You are paying for what you get, and that is a premium meat that costs more than a lot of other things, so you shouldn't have too much sticker shock going in when you realize the reality that Lobster is expensive.  I went with the Maine Lobster Roll and also ordered some Lobster Tater Tots which I shared.  The Roll bun was great, perfectly toasted and crunchy.  I did order extra lobster meat and it was falling out of the bun.  My only small critic would be for more mayo on the roll (but I generally like more mayo on things than most other people do I think) and I did come across two small shells in my roll,...not a big deal but you know, would rather have no shells in there. ;)  Lobster Tots were AMAZING!  Great tots and good Pico de Gallo salsa on top!  Big hunks of lobster claw meat,...this was by far my favorite of everything.  I'd like to try the Lobster Grilled Cheese and maybe the tacos some day.  I did find the link to Pittsburgh Food Park and will look out for Cousin's to be there some day.

6vjuQf0Hv_6NWClBCavhyQ.text: Good quality and good size portions. More butter and a little seasoning or salt Would make the Connecticut   roll a 5 star.

cOgF4J-89JgnPGNtG_VtJA.text: I had the pleasure of trying cousins Maine lobster today at Beacon 1, and it was probably one of my favorite food truck experiences ever! The staff was very quick, the food was hot and fresh, and it really doesn't get any better than having a lobster roll for lunch in Pittsburgh! If you get a chance to try this great experience, I highly recommended you do so and is worth the wait if you have to go out of your way to experience  it!

HwOUrYmIDcIaL4c2RyiYwg.text: After waiting in line for what seemed like a YEAR (45 mins.) I finally got to the front of this world class lobster food truck with images of cele-britties smattered throughout the sides.(it was nice)  They have lobster rolls, tacos, enchiladas, grilled cheese, bisque, whoopie pies???.... (the usual). I got the tacos.  They were fresh and good and light, you could taste each ingredient. I wish the flavor was stronger or they had choices liked herbed butter and garlic to add on.(They're descent but expensive)

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

_EEo5pglQl6caOiIAgOpKQ.text: Wow am I on the fence about this one. Was the lobster roll fresh, meaty and delicious? It most certainly was. If you are looking for big chunks of lobster this will be your roll. If you are someone who prefers more of a lobster dip type consistency (wholey's), meaning a whole lot of mayo and smaller pieces of lobster, you will not enjoy this.   I ordered a side of tots which was a no brainer. Tot life over everything! These tots were pretty unsatisfying. They had no flavor and were pretty soggy. I'm not sure if this was due to the fact that I didn't eat them at that very moment or if they didn't cook them enough. I had a 10 minute drive back to the office before I could chow down. For $22 I wish the roll was a little bigger to hold the meaty lobster claws. I felt like it was gone in no time, which is a good thing because that means I really liked it.   I ended up choosing the Connecticut roll which is served warm with butter and lemon. I would definitely try the Maine roll which is served cold with mayo. Initially I was going to order the lobster tots, but I am happy I decided to go for the roll instead.

876E7mVHswwezXuz5Kb8JQ.text: Delicious Maine Lobster Rolls!!  Wish I bought more.  So much lobster, the roll was overflowing. The folks working the truck were friendly and knowledgeable of their menu.  Well worth the cost! Seek them out, find them, and taste all their yummy lobster creations!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Cousins Maine Lobster Food Truck&#34;
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maine Lobster Roll

rpt3D4FaHMGxv13eTGPe-A.text: Visited the truck in Coraopolis on June 15, 2019.    The Connecticut lobster roll was wonderful.  However, I also ordered potato tots.  The bottom of the tot container was full of grease.   Needless to say, they went into the garbage.   I will defnitely return for the lobster roll, but NOT the tots.

F7Y_C6L9kSXpVCTK0oQa-A.text: Very excited to hear about the new lobster food truck in town, we were disappointed to miss their debut at Millvale food truck park and promptly signed up with their instagram account so we could cyber stalk their next location.   We looked forward to meeting for lunch at their location  in the strip district all week long and got there with eager anticipation. Luckily for us, they did not disappoint! We had studied their menu online beforehand so we could game plan what we would order and share.   We ordered one cold served Maine style lobster roll, one warm served Connecticut style lobster roll and their lobster tater tots. On the way down, we stopped at a Get Go for some Iron City Light beers to accompany lunch because you need some "bee-ah" for your "lobstah" rolls. I wish they had forks for their lobster tater tots because it was pretty impossible to eat without one with all that was going on, but I managed.   The lobster truck delivered epic Maine lobster goodness. Can't wait for my next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

d-Drtgv3rTvoVFUi_eMnaw.text: Growing up in NH and spending my summers in Maine, I'm pretty particular about my seafood. I must say, CML hit the nail on the head.  I went with my aunt on the grand opening in Pittsburgh. We waited 2 hours in line, but it was a nice day and the owner, Sabin, hung out and chatted with me for about 40 minutes and definitely helped pass the time.   I got the Maine lobster roll, lobster tots and clam chowder (thanks Sabin!) and all were so good! So good that I went back a few days later to another location to get more lobster.  This time, in addition to the Maine roll and chowder, I got a lobster grilled cheese. One word: YUM!!  It is expensive, but that's the cost for delicious and fresh seafood. It reminds me of home so I'll continue to go and support this business and the owners really care about their customers and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reading material! @henryandpenny
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pittsburgh truck. Had TVs and a payment screen as well.
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster grilled cheese, clam chowder and Maine lobster roll.

AvqszS6_lSKYqJkk66mMTA.text: I will start by saying that I LOVE lobster rolls.  I seek them out wherever I go because there is nothing better in my humble opinion.  When I found out that there was a lobster food truck in my area, I stalked them until they came to my area.  I gathered family and friends and placed a huge order (5 Connecticut, 1 Maine, and one grilled cheese lobster sandwich.)  We got home and tore into the bag.  Were we ever DISAPPOINTED!!!!  The rolls were small and BLAND! We couldn't tell the difference between the Connecticut and the Maine rolls if it weren't for the temperature difference.  There wasn't even the faintest hint of butter on any of the rolls.  The grilled cheese has pepper jack cheese which completely overpowers the lobster.  So after everyone ate, we took a vote and all seven said we would not be interested in eating from their food truck again.  The taste was just not there.

iGeW9HJHW-UK8u7EPMzuGA.text: After hearing they had a truck in PGH, I was dying to try them!  Little did i know they were at the Y tonight, I couldn't wait! ....... Only to be disappointed. Ordered the Connecticut roll, Lobster tacos, lobster grilled cheese, and Kids grilled cheese and tots. For a total of $55. I thought ok, it's gonna be awesome so so what ! First, the lobster roll was TINY! , tacos had no taste, the lobster grilled cheese was ok, kids meal was good. I don't mind paying for a good meal, but when I feel like I got ripped off that's when I have a problem.  I understand that Food trucks in general are a bit more expensive, but they are way overpriced. In my opinion if you want a good lobster roll go to Rolands in the strip, DOUBLE the size and a buck cheaper.

2NeGWU3JQxksYZs_YsUiHQ.text: If you haven't tried Cousins Maine Lobster, do yourself a favor and find that truck, wait in line and indulge in an excellent lobster roll. My personal favorite is the Connecticut Roll, however, I fully endorse every other item on the list. The food is always fresh, the service always top notch and the price is just right for the quality of food you're eating. You'll have to keep an eye out for where they'll be because the truck is always on the move. If you have to drive 30+ minutes to finally try it, do it. You will not be disappointed. Best food truck in Pgh.

dN9ckox_g1j_sVAsJ9OTdg.text: "I know you can be underwhelmed, and you can be overwhelmed, but can you ever just be, like, whelmed?" This is exactly how I feel about this food truck. There is so much hype surrounding it, lines are crazy long and sometimes they run out of food. My husband and I were amped to try it when it came to a food truck rally "near" our house.  I got a Connecticut roll and he got the lobster grilled cheese and tots... $40 later we got our food.  Mine was supposed to be warm it was as if someone held the lobster in their hand for a few mins and then put it on the roll, there was supposed to be lemon and mayo. It was all in the first bite... nothing after that. My husband said there was one discernible piece of lobster and the rest was just a grilled cheese sandwich. The tots were just tots nothing exciting-not even seasoning.  I guess we can say we've tried it. But I can assure you we won't be back.  $40 and we were still hungry not worth the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

y_TKGE47SYMkMfK2ckDX-A.text: The lobster roll was really good, but for the price you get about 3 bites... $15. I mean for the hype it brings, I guess it is worth it. But I think you can get a lobster roll down at Rolland's for a better price and larger portion. I mean since they've been endorsed by shark tank and other investors, etc. there are a lot of good reviews and it already has a name for itself. I'll probably try the quesadilla if I get to the truck again, but I'm not going to break my neck to find the truck again. I'm not convinced it's the best in pgh.

1rCW7Yrp-otMaNjs3A93jA.text: The lobster grilled cheese tasted like butter and bread. The lobster quesadilla was on par with something from Taco Bell. None of the lobster we paid for was noticeable in the items we bought. I can't believe for the amount of money we spent there and it was average at best. Most disappointing food truck I have had in the Pittsburgh area.

Kq4jr4aiY_mpnN0blQo6zg.text: I'm impressed! I expected the food to be good but it was better than I expected. The value was better than I expected. The service was better than I expected. Such a great experience. I would give 4 stars just because there's always room for improvement but I can't imagine this experience being any better.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6u89NSR95U_orDytth2cvw.text: Wow! Outstanding lobster dishes served by a team that is working hard to please every customer. We shared most of the menu tonight and there were no lobster offerings that we would not order again.  Outstanding food, great service!

bSk1O25ILRMCIXN3vhkx1Q.text: We...LOVE, LOVE, LOVE  Cousins Maine Lobster Truck! My husband says.."Over the Top"! Food is delicious...convenient locations.. Lobster fresh ..Fav..Lobster Tots.. Lobster Rolls and Tacos..Oh My! Great weekday dinner out..

Z4Kw364akYDZ4OXOs8ffmA.text: It's lobster, I get it.  I never pass up an opportunity to have lobster served to me in a timely, convenient manner, but will I return to this particular venue? Probably not.  I do not mind splurging every now and then for this kind of rare luxury, but I have to say, I have had better.   The wow factor occurred when given the choice between having the lobster roll served warm or cold .  I chose cold, Maine-style.  Portion was generous,  I did take advantage of adding more lobster meat for an additional $4 , but it lacked any kind of flavor.  The mayo was a small dot on the buttered grilled bun.    Doubtful if I order the lobster roll again, but I might try another item on the menu if I find myself passing by this food truck another time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bzAFBFjAspv2FBIzViBNYg.text: As soon as I saw the logo on the truck in the distance, I made a mad dash through the crowded streets towards the gates of heaven which is Cousins Maine Lobster. My fiancee couldn't understand why I would even consider paying over $20 for food truck sandwiches, but soon she would comprehend my excitement.   I had heard and seen pictures of the famous lobster rolls and lobster grilled cheese for months and I was in disbelief that I was finally about to experience this wonderful feeling. The saying better late than never, couldn't be more True when it comes to how long I waited to try Cousins Maine Lobster. The huge, hunks of fresh coldwater lobster were present in every bite! My fiancee proclaimed it was easily the best grilled cheese she'd ever had in life, and I know for a fact that the lobster roll was the best I'd ever tasted.  Cousins Maine Lobster has a reputation and a name that precedes itself for good reason. I can't describe the warm, happy feeling I got seeing this truck and finally having the chance to eat their lobster. I pinky-promise you don't want to miss out, find out where they'll be and go!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Grilled Cheese. No words needed
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Easily the best lobster roll in &#39;tahn!

XXQZ9ZfvraDOSyM8jUQp_g.text: I have been wanting to try this food truck for a long time so it came to Food Truck Festival in Zelienople. I ordered one Maine Lobster Roll and one Connecticut Lobster Roll but when we sat down to eat they were both the same which was OK because it was good but just too bad they could`t get the order right especially when you are paying $15.75 each. They also Have Lobster gilled cheese, Tarter tots, Lobster Taco`s and the two Lobster Rolls Maine or Connecticut, and a Whoopie pie for dessert. They have Napkins foil bags hot sauce outside the ordering window but no silverware. There is a computer screen on the outside that you can see when they ring you up.  Pros: Lobster Rolls are DELICIOUS   Cons: They were an hour late to event staff is not friendly and did`t get my order correct.  After arriving late to event the line was a half of block long and still did not open for another half and hour, so that is why I only give them 4 stars. I will try them again in the future and hope the customer service is better and they are on time and can get the order correct!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Zelienople Food Truck Festival, Cousin`s Maine Lobster
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maine Lobster Roll
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Order window

kOqj4fEzSWujaN9d2b7v2A.text: OM Lobster deliciousness.  I am a lobster fan.  And I don't always give out 5 .  Not that I am difficult just that I expect a lot.  When I saw the long line I was annoyed because I thought, all these people were getting in the way of me and my lobster !  After a 35 minute wait, it was my turn to order.  We ordered a Connecticut roll, 2 lobster tail and tots, and a kids grilled cheese.  The lobster  roll was to die for.  The tail and tots were also good, had a little kick to them, but the salty balanced nicely with the meal.  I am so glad I finally got to try this place.   On another note some are complaining about the price but lobster ain't cheap, so $15 for a lobster is pretty standard fare.    Eat up, butter cup!

7LsdD-f57fX1SJEvRAFqeQ.text: HO-LY crap!  Ok so my boss is from Maine and she's been asking me to try out this food truck for a while. Well I forgot my lunch one day so I decided why not. I wasn't prepared to be impressed because we were not in Maine and I didnt think a food truck could produce the level of food I'm looking for. I STAND CORRECTED. I got the lobster tots and I about passed out in the parking lot where the truck was parked. I don't think I have ever thought bout how well beautifully buttered lobster and tater tots could go together. They should get married. There was just the right Amount of chunks of lobster, sauce and tomatoes. I could eat it for every meal, every day of the week. Thank you Maine Lobster!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster tots

z4TiwdvjBim0g19ClCwg-g.text: Was very excited when the truck finally came to an area near me.  I believe the other good reviews are extremely biased or they don't know what lobster should taste like.    For $26 I had the Maine lobster roll, tots and a root beer  The roll was on what looked and felt like a hot dog bun only mildly toasted. The lobster was like warm and had no lemon or butter taste at all. Extremely BLAND.  How can the signature menu item be so lackluster? I could have steamed a lobster at home and tasted better.  The tots were $5 , and in my guess frozen tots.  I have had much better lobster (Roland's in the strip) AND much better food trucks.  I have never been so disappointed after spending so much money especially when there is so much hype.  Thankful I didn't travel far or take my family If you are like me and have been wanting to try this truck you probably will, but will probably be disappointed

qZiZRbuouHdsAhBZ6mkkKw.text: Have been watching out for them and finally was able to make time.   The food was absolutely delicious I can't wait to go again.   Big pieces of lobster very fulfilling

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Connecticut Lobster sandwich and the Lobster Tots
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cousin Maine Lobster food truck

OFV5S9WUC0xh06g5GkRICQ.text: This is a must if you love lobster and don't want to spend an expensive evening at a fine restaurant. The lobster is straight from the coast of Maine and is fresh. We got the lobster grilled cheese and lobster tacos along with a side of tater tots and was not disappointed. The only reason I didn't give it a five is I'm not a seafood expert and the wait was quite long as only one person was cooking while the other handled money and packaged the orders. You'd you're a lobster fan this for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster grilled cheese

qndO5aGLaGq3N-w2g3yU0g.text: I literally stalk this place weekly and will travel to eat there.  It's dang near pathetic how obsessed I am.  Friends who haven't seen me in a while ask me why I keep posting photos of lobster rolls to social media.  They don't understand.

frBdMGTR-eARPtptj-r76A.text: I have been waiting for the CML truck to open in Pittsburgh after having eaten at the Orlando truck several times. It was ok, but frankly disappointing.  (Orlando was way better!!) Lobster was fresh and plentiful in the rolls.  The lobster tacos were mostly onion.  Service was not wonderful - the server did not apologize for dropping half an order of (cold) tater tots on my mom's head and was rude when we asked for the soup missing from our order. I know it's only their second or third week - so hopefully things can be improved.  For $68 for 3 meals they will need to step it up.  Revised Opinion - Many months ago Cousins was new to Pgh and I was disappointed.  That was not the case today!  If the crowd was any indication of the following the truck has gained around the city....I was hoping for the best and I was not disappointed.  Service was excellent and the food was great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. New England lobster roll and tots.

zkoppiePn2coWYzopingXQ.text: We were lucky enough to try Cousins Maine Lobster without the super long lines when they were at Stick City Brewing in Mars.   In our group we had a lobster roll, lobster tots and shrimp tacos. The lobster roll was your typical lobster deliciousness. Highlight for me was the lobster tots. I think that's the best deal for your dollars. The shrimp tacos were a bit of a disappointment. Since this is a seafood-based food truck, I was expecting regular sized shrimp. These were the super tiny shrimp, like the size of the shrimp you get if you buy the Chicken of the Sea shrimp in a can.   Definitely on the pricier side. I enjoyed the meal, but I also don't know that I'd stand in line for it either.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vSPR0C3AdYS60Dg-LIHCaA.text: We chase the truck all over North Pittsburgh! One of few place in the city to get a solid lobster roll. The staff is very nice, food is great quality and they take the bus to some breweries up north which is really convenient.

kJxSppC2OfF4JGW30rngIw.text: I waited in line for over an hour, while the truck was parked at Helltown (formerly Rivertown) in Murrysville.  I was really disappointed when it came down to it.  I got a lobster roll and lobster tacos.  The bill came to $31.  It was so small that it didnt come close to feeding us.  It was good, just really small.

7j1gs202EP3fZ4DWWvAy2A.text: I've had my eye on this food truck for quite some time now so when I learned it was going to be at the greater Pittsburgh food truck festival at the Meadows my husband and I headed down there.  We arrived almost 30 minutes before the festival opened and there was already a line about half a block long for this truck alone! Not counting the time we waited for the festival to open we waited approx another 25 minutes until we made it to the front window to order.  I decided to order the Connecticut hot lobster roll and my husband ordered the Maine cold lobster roll. For $15.75 a piece they each come on a New England style roll. Condiments and napkins are right outside so I would suggest that you get them before you order. They have no silverware. Gluten free options are available.  We got our food fairly fast-team is very efficient! We were able to take our food inside the lobby of the Meadows to sit down and eat it.  Mine was partially heated but tasty. It had the buttery taste to it and there were large chunks of meat. I would assume it was the butter that cooled it off.  It was a bit messy so I'm glad we took a bunch of napkins before we ordered.  I sampled my husband's Maine lobster with the lemon wedge and I found it chunky and fresh! It does comes chilled and had a touch of mayo on it. It is cooked lobster but served cold. He really enjoyed it. Both rolls included lobster claws.  This food truck is pricey but that's what I would expect to pay for lobster. It's not cheap. We decided to forgo the side of tots and whoopie pie since we wanted to get dessert elsewhere. When we returned I saw that the line had tripled!!!   I like the fact that they will show you your order on a computer screen to confirm accuracy. Most people pay with cards because this place alone really adds up.  Not too often one finds real Maine lobster and it is a luxury dish. They have a few restaurants in other cities and we are one of the few cities to have their food trucks.  If you wish to try them out then they have a website which gives their schedule one week at a time. My suggestion is definitely to get here as early as possible because you may end up waiting over an hour to get to the front of the line. This appears to be one of most popular food trucks in the Pittsburgh area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Connecticut roll
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maine roll cold cooked lobster
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Celebrities photos on side of truck

ePQ9-uTYOAgC9ADPnohMjA.text: I've heard people rave about this food truck and I've never had the chance to try it. That day finally came when I learned they were going to be here for one day only at the arts fest.   Looking at the menu I thought ok this is a little pricey but it everyone says it's amazing then it's worth it. I ended up ordering the Connecticut roll. I was sadly pretty disappointed with it. Seemed like it had little to no flavor. Just tasted like lobster between 2 slices of bread. Would be nice to have a little sauce or extra flavor of some kind. My coworkers told me the cold roll was much better so I would be willing to give it a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

42l6wDbaMrzJGfJmYk7nuQ.text: The Maine lobster roll (served chilled) is the one with the lemon and the Connecticut (serves warm) was the other (not that it matters cause the look the same but just Incase)they were  both incredible and the tater tots were good and crispy too!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maine lobster roll (one with lemon slice on it) and Connecticut lobster roll with tater tots

mhDpn4UDVEhlTCwOWgCphQ.text: Ordered the lobster bisque and lobster tater tots and was not disappointed. I enjoyed both. A bit pricey but it IS Lobster. The bisque had fewer chucks of lobster than what I am used to getting in a good bisque. But it still was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Tots and cup of bisque
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside Stick City Brewing
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Truck outside Stick City Brewing Dec. 29, 2018

K0dEEzCwQTGvQREyuColww.text: Huge giant chunks of lobster?  Yes please!  My trusty sidekick and I obviously had to try both types of lobster rolls (Connecticut- served warm w/butter and lemon or Maine- served chilled w/a touch of mayo) to see which one we preferred.  While both were loaded with huge lobster pieces and both were good the Connecticut was the winner in my book.  It was a little pricey for food truck food but honestly it was loaded with so much lobster goodness I gladly forked over my money.    I will continue to stalk where the food truck will be so I can indulge in this deluxe treat.  So glad they're in Pittsburgh now so we can have authentic and delicious lobster rolls - my latest obsession.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster tacos - switched out flour tortillas for corn
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Last luscious bite...
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maine lobster roll - served cold - delicious too

d5WmF6VaDYKxi0A2Kvef0A.text: I really can't say I agree at all with the 4.5 star rating, unfortunately.   I was very excited when Cousins Maine Lobster came to the office I work at, and the large line in front of the truck seemed to indicate I wouldn't be disappointed.  The truck is adorned with various media placards, such as "Shark Tank" and pictures with Gordon Ramsay. The menu is a flat screen television built into the side of the truck with a flap that swings up in order to shield it from the sun and make it more visible. After ordering, a touch screen is in front of you, again on the side of the truck, allowing you to tip and request a receipt by email. And you also get a pager for your order.  But all of this bling must be the reason that the food is, in my opinion, extremely overpriced. I ordered a lobster grilled cheese ($14) as a combo with tater tots and a drink (+$5) while leaving a 15% tip, which is the minimum tip suggestion on the touch screen. After tax, my total came out to $23.18.  The grilled cheese consisted of two standard sized, Texas style slices of toast, the sort you would find in a grocery store -- not oversized, like you would find in many restaurants -- with two slices of cheese, one cheddar, and I believe the other was pepper jack, and then pieces of lobster on top.  The grilled cheese by itself can't be more than something you'd pay $5 for by itself. There was definitely not $9 of lobster included on it. The can of soda was likewise not worth more than $1 after markup, and the tater tots certainly not $4.  The food was OK, but not anything special. After feeling so let down by the overcharge, I researched the franchise, and found that buying in to a truck costs a minimum of $160,000 to $360,000. Because of this, I don't blame the owners of the franchise at all for the price they're asking, but I do feel the customer is paying in excess to recoup the cost to run one of their trucks.  I just can't recommend it at all, unless you're a big lobster fan, and don't mind being overcharged.
